pages.text: Sautéed dishes are another class of custom cuisines provided by Caupona. They are cooked in $(l:intro/frying_pans)pans or griddles$(/l). The properties of a sautéed dish are the sum of all its ingredients.

Like $(l:intro/soup)soups and stews$(/l), raw ingredients and their cooked counterparts are not distinguished in sautéing. Compare to soup cooking, sautéing needs no fluid bases and is much faster, which also means a less consumption of fuel. However, the saturation granted by sautéed dishes is lower and potions cannot be added.
Use shift + right click to place sautéed dishes in the world.
